subject.normal: Cleaning Up Route 54 (between sungai buloh and LDP interchange)

headers.subject: Re: Cleaning Up Route 54 (between sungai buloh and LDP interchange)
headers.received: by gwaa18 with SMTP id a18sf2469051gwa.15 for <google.larry.sergey@a.markmail.org>; Sun, 20 Jun 2010 03:26:45 -0700 (PDT)

body.para: Decided to take your advice and re-cycle roads as much as I can. So I "undid" my deletes, and started recycling with this one:
I moved it further up to re-use it as the downramp of the overpass. Quite happy with the results.
Then I tried to adjust the intersection at the overpass itself ...
"Bad data (Road Section Inconsistent) has been found in this area. Please report this error with a link to this page. Some data in this area is bad and cannot..."
And now touching any of the connecting roads gives me the same ...

Yeah, GMM's moderating feature ideally would provide for better and more consistent quality maps compared to OSM's "do-as-you-like" approach -- so I'm still a believer, for now 8-). The main problem I see is too much of the earlier traces were done and accepted on a "something is better than nothing" basis, and now the GMM moderating feature works against fixing it easily. Apparently making a lot of changes to "mature features" brings down your "karma" points too. 8-(
